intro: Sphaeranthus variabilis, commonly known as the variable globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, woolly seed pods and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sphaeranthus variabilis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value.
